page.title: 14TRAFFIC IN BALMEDIE
page.content: Over a period of two days our group did a traffic survey at the main road, the A92 which goes through Balmedie. We spent 15 minutes each day counting the total number of cars etc. which passed us in either direction. We also took the registration number of each car to see where the traffic was coming from. We found on average for a 15 minute period cars = 232 buses= 2 lorries = 27 motor bikes = 4. This means 11.7 vehicles passed us every minute which is approx. one every 10 seconds. This shows just how busy the main road is, and how much we need a crossing. From our work with the car numbers we found the traffic came from Aberdeen 56%, Glasgow 6%, Keith 5%, Edinburgh 4%, Huddersfield 3%, London 3%, the remaining 23% came from all over the country.
